name: NEKOPARA Vol. 0
description: Please note that NEKOPARA Vol. 0 is a fandisc for NEKOPARA Vol. 1What's NEKOPARA? Why, it's a cat paradise! This is a story just before Kashou opened "La Soleil".Enjoy a page from the leisurely, daily lives of Shigure and the Minaduki household's catgirls!

It's Nekopara, you should play it regardless of the cost, as a visual novel while it is mostly slice of life, it also has excellent writing which will keep you involved, this is a prequel and it's also 1/3rd of the cost of Volume 1 which is why it is as short as it is (I finished in 1.2 hours) and Volume 1 took me about 3 days on and off to finish, that includes reading all the nudity parts in the R18+ version.  All of your favorite catgirls make an appearance in this novel and are more prominent now than they were in the last one, this is less focused on Chocola and Vanilla and more focused on all of the cats and Shigure, it's a really adorable novel despite its shortness and also gives you a bit of insight into what life was like before Volume 1 and is also really a good hype builder for Volume 2 which comes out in December. The soundtrack in this novel includes quite a few songs from the soundtrack of Volume 1, which is comforting and also familiar, instead of trying to reinvent the wheel they simply renovated it and brought in a few changes to the OST, while also keeping true to the style.  Pros: You can pet your cats. You can make your cats boobs bounce. Great writing that will keep you involved. Familiar and comforting soundtrack. Many of the CGs include all of the cats, and it's in true Sayori style.  Neutral: Short length, which is really helpful for staying involved but it can also be a bit of a shame that it ends so quickly.  Cons: I can't really think of any major cons, actually, maybe it's just because I've known of Chocola and Vanilla since 2010 so anything involving them is something I absolutely adore.

Nekopara Vol. 0 is the presequel to the events that occur in Nekopara Vol. 1.  Story The story is pretty much outlined in the description on the steam store. 'The eldest daughter of the Minaduki household and their 6 catgirls go to wake up their master; prepare breakfast; clean up the house; go out on a walk; make dinner; take a bath; sleep together; et cetera, et cetera. ' Sadly it outlines the majority of what this visual novel has to offer, which can be a bit of a spoiler, but the interactions and personality of the catgirls does offer some light comedy. Their differing personalities, as well as their curuiosity, does lead to them to sometimes being more troublesome than helpful. This being said, the visual novel is a bit short, and can be fully read in about 30 to 50 minutes, depending on your reading speed.  Notable features -As you all may have noticed, there is a hand on the top right of the screen while playing the game, pressing it engages in a petting 'minigame'. This minigame pauses the game's dialogue, allowing you to pet the characters on screen. This is not limited to the catgirls, you can even pet shigure. The petting feature goes a bit further, making the characters react differently; based on where you choose to pet them. -Trading cards with more cute backgrounds and emoticons. -Artwork is similar to that of its predecessor, having some scenes played out in their adorable chibi form, and many other scenes in their normal form. Art is a bit more lewd, as it has a shower scene with shigure as well as the catgirls.(use your imagination)  Verdict 7/10  At the time of this review, there is a small typo, in which Maple asks Coconut if she is sure she can finish all the food she wanted, but refers to her as cinnamon.
You can pet them and make them bounce.
I can never wash this stain from my Library

I'll admit: I'm a sucker for cute/lewd things. So i knew i was gonna love it regardless of whether the story and characters were good or not. But surprisingly, i found myself a lot more entertained than i thought i would.  The characters aren't exactly -diverse- or -interesting-, but for a comedy that doesn't take itself very seriously, it's not really a big deal. These characters (and this game, in general) were DESIGNED to pander to a certain audience, and that's not neccesarily bad as long as it's done right. And i think this game is a pretty good example of it.  While the 'story' and characters don't stand that well on their own, what really got me hooked for this game is:    The humor and visual gags   The GORGEOUS artstyle   The catchy, cute soundtrack   The general sweet tone to it   You're not gonna play this game for the amazing plot. You're gonna play it because it's fun, cute and entertaining. Nekopara doesn't give you what your brain wants to see, but what your heart wants to see. If you're a fan of visual novels, it's guaranteed to leave you with a warm feeling of joy inside, and a smile on your face.
cute girls : CHECK cute girls with cat-ear : CHECK cute voice : CHECK bath scene : CHECK petting : CHECK can touch boob : CHECK bouncing : CHECK low storage needed : CHECK 11/10 would play again

Nekopara is a visual novel series, so the majority of the gameplay consists of the player reading the game's story. Nekopara does not offer choices to the player throughout gameplay, and the player has no influence over the story. The games are fully voiced (except for the protagonist) and use a system called 'E-mote' that allows the in-game characters to be animated, instead of stationary sprites. Nekopara Vol. 0 added a new feature where the player can click on characters in-game, to 'pet' them. The characters will react in different ways depending on where the player pets them.   This is what Wikipedia told me...
Dont forget to press P and Pet your nekos!

I got this 'game' for a big discount and i love Japanese MANGA style artwork. It is mostly a short story with a little 'hands on' gameplay featuring cats and their owner as Japanese Anime Girls all cuddly and cute. It is a nice change if you just want something a little different to do and don't want to interact much. So sit back and enjoy the nice story. It's inexpensive and you do get all the 'perks' with Achievements and Trading cards for those who collect 'em. This is a three part story . . .so far. Gotta love the 'Catfights' 10/10

Alright, so this is a very cute game. It's a prequel to NekoPara Vol:1, but you do not have to have played it to play Nekopara Vol:2. Just like the first game, it has amazing design, moving characters, and great voice acting. You can even pet each of them! All the characters are cute -Mostly Vanilla and Cinnamon- This game took me a little more than an hour to complete, so don't be expecting a game it will take you a few days to finish. But for the price I think it is 100% worth it. Plus you get some bath pictures of everyone~

Nekopara as we all know is a war story of a ww2 unit known as the 'Hellcats'. The Grumman F6F Hellcat was an American carrier-based fighter aircraft designed to replace the earlier F4F Wildcat in United States Navy (USN) service. The Hellcat competed with the faster Vought F4U Corsair for use as a carrier based fighter. The Corsair had significant issues with carrier landings which the Hellcat did not, allowing the Hellcat to become the Navy's dominant fighter in the second part of World War II, a position the Hellcat did not relinquish. The Corsair instead was primarily deployed to great effect in land-based use by the U.S. Marine Corps.  Although the F6F resembled the Wildcat in some ways, it was a new design, powered by a 2,000 hp Pratt & Whitney R-2800, the same powerplant used for both the Corsair and the United States Army Air Force (USAAF) Republic P-47 Thunderbolt fighters. Some military observers tagged the Hellcat as the 'Wildcat's big brother'.  The F6F was best known for its role as a rugged, well-designed carrier fighter which was able, after its combat debut in early 1943, to counter the Mitsubishi A6M Zero and help secure air superiority over the Pacific Theater. Such was the quality of the basic simple, straightforward design, that 12,200 were built in just over two years.  Hellcats were credited with destroying a total of 5,223 enemy aircraft while in service with the U.S. Navy, U.S. Marine Corps and the Royal Navy Fleet Air Arm.This was more than any other Allied naval aircraft. Postwar, the Hellcat was phased out of front line service but remained in service as late as 1954 as a night fighter.  10/10 you read a wiki page.

Prequel to Vol.1, Vol. 0 explores the catgirls daily lives one hour at a time. Same high quality art as well as very cute voice work. Would strongly recommend for players of the first game or anyone looking to get into the series. Be warned it is very short with no replay ability but at the $2.99 price point is worth it if you enjoy these types of games.  Comes with trading cards that hold some solid value while the game is still new help make it a good purchase as well.   Looking forward to Vol. 2.

This game was an emotional rollercoaster from beginning to end. Yet it is a very brilliant commentary on our modern interconnected society. In this interactive anime episode, you play as Kashou, an 'owner of a pastry store' but you are in fact a depressed man who owns six different types of cats. As a side effect of your various medication, you see your cats as underaged anime girls who enjoy referencing hentai, incest and beastiality.   In the mean time, I need to go see a doctor.

A cute catgirl sim game which is more of an animated visual short story about the Nekopara girls. The animation is charming and the characters are adorable and cleanly animated. Petting the girls on the head makes them mewl and meow, also very adorable.  Though this game can be completed in around 1 hour. The achievements are few and and can't be missed during gameplay and the game is straight up linear. There is no real personal input from the player (aside from petting mode) and clicking/space bar to scroll dialog.  If you like Nekopara and/or catgirl sim stories and Petting mode give this a go. But at 63 min of game play a̶n̶d̶ ̶n̶o̶ ̶r̶e̶a̶l̶ ̶p̶l̶a̶y̶e̶r̶ ̶i̶n̶p̶u̶t̶ I don't think this game is worth my $2.99.  Pros: Good animation Great voice acting Very cute and funny character interactions and shenanigans It has Catgirls! Petting Mode Providesa bit of backstory to Nekopara Vol. 1  Cons:  1 hour of gameplay (you could get longer lasting games for the same price) b̶a̶s̶i̶c̶a̶l̶l̶y̶ ̶a̶ ̶s̶h̶o̶r̶t̶ ̶s̶t̶o̶r̶y̶ ̶s̶i̶m̶ ̶g̶a̶m̶e̶ ̶w̶i̶t̶h̶ ̶n̶o̶ ̶p̶l̶a̶y̶e̶r̶ ̶c̶h̶o̶i̶c̶e̶.̶ *Took this out as booby-cat is right* Achievements are given to you just for playing the game (Doesn't really need such pointless easy achievements) Is based off the existing Nekopara game engine and characters to spin some money?  (Should be a $0.99 DLC option with Nekopara Vol. 1) Essentially only offeres Petting Mode and a bit of backstory  Is this worth $2.99?

I initially bought this as a fun way to kill some time with friends as we point and laugh at the weaboo thing. Jesus, this game is pure fun. There are lewd, easy-going catgirls that just warm your heart and put a big dumb smile on your face as you sit about and watch the antics.  For US$2.99 (4.24 Down Under Dollars), it's actually a good price for what turns out to be an hour long slice-of-life collection.

P.S #2: the petting is easily a cuteness scale overload!

I am gonna tell people what this game is and the new function of this game  This is a kind of AVG or we generally call it as Galgame in Japan. well this is not the focus of my review. The characters are designed by Sayori who is a Chinese and what she designed has already got a great fame in Japan.  but I have to remind the player that want to buy it or wondering whether it is good or not.... DON'T think that this game give you any epic feeling or serious moment of meditating about life. This is just a CASUAL GALGAME but not some galgames in Japan that make you cry make you sad. Play it as a casual way. well the design of character is really wonderfull as I am the fan(maybe a little) of Sayori since I have read the comics when I was in secondary school.  This is Vol 0 , that means is a story the before the Vol 1 AND the most important thing is that there is a new function this time , you can show tender care (sex care(?)) for those cats you can stroke their head , breast , leg  quite good experience bro plz put your TWO hands on the keyboard :)

A short but enjoyable experiance, and for the very reasonable price of $2.99 I can reccomend it to anyone looking for an adorable experiance. Now I haven't played the other Nekopara games as this was a gift from a wonderful friend, so I can't tell you how good it is compared to the other Nekopara games. I really loved to art style and voice acting, the characters were all quircky and likable for their own reasons. I can't say I have a favorite but I'm really fond of Coconut.  Also, bewbs <3

Nekoparo Vol. 0 is the prologue to the first volume of the series of Nekopara.  It's a short, but sweet visual novel about Kashou's nekos in the day to day life with Shigure.  Now this game doesn't involve any ♥♥♥♥♥ Destruction or Scenes of the like, but does first implement the petting mechanics,  a beloved part that is now in the series of games or at least in volume 2.   This game is a short little game, just to kick back to and get some story out of. Plus its cheap AF, so why not give it a buy you dirty weeaboo.   Tl;dr If you want some back story to your neko waifus before you destroy them with your Kashou Dong then give it a buy
